trans-unit.source: The following C# code snippet demonstrates one approach to handling retries.
trans-unit.target: The following C# code snippet demonstrates one approach to handling retries.

trans-unit.source: It uses a simple try/catch block that inspects the request exception to determines whether to retry the request.
trans-unit.target: It uses a simple try/catch block that inspects the request exception to determines whether to retry the request.

trans-unit.source: This does not handle all exception scenarios, but it handles most of the exceptions that are thrown by the Microsoft .NET WebClient and WCF Data Services clients.
trans-unit.target: This does not handle all exception scenarios, but it handles most of the exceptions that are thrown by the Microsoft .NET WebClient and WCF Data Services clients.

trans-unit.source: The retry logic includes a delay that begins at one second and doubles with each retry.
trans-unit.target: The retry logic includes a delay that begins at one second and doubles with each retry.

trans-unit.source: The delay includes a pseudo-random factor that makes concurrent requests less likely.
trans-unit.target: The delay includes a pseudo-random factor that makes concurrent requests less likely.
